1.text: My son, if thou wilt receive my words, and hide my commandments with thee;

2.text: So that thou incline thine ear unto wisdom, [and] apply thine heart to understanding;

3.text: Yea, if thou criest after knowledge, [and] liftest up thy voice for understanding;

4.text: If thou seekest her as silver, and searchest for her as [for] hid treasures;

5.text: Then shalt thou understand the fear of the LORD, and find the knowledge of God.

6.text: For the LORD giveth wisdom: out of his mouth [cometh] knowledge and understanding.

7.text: He layeth up sound wisdom for the righteous: [he is] a buckler to them that walk uprightly.

8.text: He keepeth the paths of judgment, and preserveth the way of his saints.

9.text: Then shalt thou understand righteousness, and judgment, and equity; [yea], every good path.

10.text: When wisdom entereth into thine heart, and knowledge is pleasant unto thy soul;

11.text: Discretion shall preserve thee, understanding shall keep thee:

12.text: To deliver thee from the way of the evil [man], from the man that speaketh froward things;

13.text: Who leave the paths of uprightness, to walk in the ways of darkness;

14.text: Who rejoice to do evil, [and] delight in the frowardness of the wicked;

15.text: Whose ways [are] crooked, and [they] froward in their paths:

16.text: To deliver thee from the strange woman, [even] from the stranger [which] flattereth with her words;

17.text: Which forsaketh the guide of her youth, and forgetteth the covenant of her God.

18.text: For her house inclineth unto death, and her paths unto the dead.

19.text: None that go unto her return again, neither take they hold of the paths of life.

20.text: That thou mayest walk in the way of good [men], and keep the paths of the righteous.

21.text: For the upright shall dwell in the land, and the perfect shall remain in it.

22.text: But the wicked shall be cut off from the earth, and the transgressors shall be rooted out of it.
